Package tage.networking.client

Class TCPClientSocket

java.lang.Object
java.net.Socket
tage.networking.client.TCPClientSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IClientSocket
public class TCPClientSocket extends Socket implements IClientSocket
A client socket for sending and receiving packets using the TCP protocol. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from client side of a game. The underlying Socket is used in this implementation.
Author:
Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPClientSocket

      public TCPClientSocket()
      Constructor to create an unconnected client socket. The socket should be connected via connectTo(InetAddress, int) before being used. See Socket().

    • TCPClientSocket

      public TCPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and port specified. See Socket(String, int).
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • TCPClientSocket

      public TCPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket bound to the local address, local port and connected to the remote address and remote port. See Socket(InetAddress, int, InetAddress, int).
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      localAddr - local address to bind to.
      localPort - local port to bind to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • TCPClientSocket

      public TCPClientSocket(String remoteAddr, int remotePort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port. The remote address string form should be able to be resolved to an IP address via InetAddress.getByName(String). See Socket(String, int).
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • TCPClientSocket

      public TCPClientSocket(String remoteAddr, int remotePort, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket bound to the local address, local port and connected to the remote address and remote port. The remote address string form should be able to be resolved to an IP address via InetAddress.getByName(String). See Socket(String, int, InetAddress, int).
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      localAddr - local address to bind to.
      localPort - local port to bind to.
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • connectTo

      public void connectTo(InetAddress remoteAddress, int remotePort) throws IOException
      Connects the client socket to the specified InetAddress and port. The client socket should be connected before being used. Uses Socket.connect(java.net.SocketAddress) to connect this socket to the address and port.
      Specified by:
      connectTo in interface IClientSocket
      Parameters:
      remoteAddress - the address to connect the socket to.
      remotePort - the port to connect the socket to.
      Throws:
      IOException

      public void shutdown() throws IOException
